Description: Terracotta ithyphallic figure of Harpocrates, with jar. A youth, modelled in the round and seated on a low plinth conforming to his shape. He is naked, with a shaven head and side-lock. A colossal phallus extends from between his raised thighs; he looks to his left, and holds with both hands a large rounded pot that rests on the root of the phallus. Solid; two-piece mould. Micaceous red-brown clay with an orangebrown surface and a thick grey core; traces of a whitish dressing.
Curator's comments: Similar to various Harpocrates figures found at Naukratis but holding a tambour, Ashmolean Museum (Oxford, no.1966.1079; Catling 1967, 15 and 17). Catling, H. W. (ed.). 1967. Ashmolean Museum, Sir John and Lady Beazley Gifts 1912-1966, London.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3244)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DC.203) (Phase 1)
Condition: The plinth is damaged and the tip of the phallus is lost.
